Right I have a spare ten minutes so here's an update of the specs of my 1957 samba originally from Luxembourg.....

From back to front.....

1600 blow through turbo motor build by myself (covered 2k miles).....

-CB 044 35 x 40 ported heads.
-HD pushrods.
-Autocraft 1:25 rockers.
-New 1600 pistons & barrels.
-Berg 30mm oil pump with full flow cooling, external Fram HP1 filtration & mesa 16 row cooler.
-Full set of Autometer Cobalt gauges including a/f gauge & lambda.
-Flowed & de-choked Renault 5 turbo carb.
-Full stainless boost pipes.
-CB breather.
-Gene Berg counterweighted crank pulley.
-Bosch uprated electric fuel pump.
-Charge cooler with Golf VR6 auxiliary water pump & 2 x YZ 125 radiators for cooling.
-CB performance turbo header.
-Garrett T3 turbo with 360 degree thrust bearing, new genuine Garrett core & staggered rear oil seal.

Running gear.....

-1303's' I.R.S gearbox.
-Intermediate gearbox mount.
-Full creative I.R.S with adjustable spring plates.
-Fully rebuilt 68 bay hubs with new drums, shoes, cables, wheel cylinders & bearings.
-Braided brake hoses all round.

-Dubfabs 4" narrowed beam with multi fit shock towers.
-My own 3 1/2" dropped spindles.
-CSP 14" wheel drilled & vented disk brake kit.
-Creative rack & pinion steering.

Info on other accessories/bits with the bus.....

-Bosch scripted front fog light.
-NOS genuine deluxe mirrors.
-Harp mirror arms.
-6 x genuine pop-outs with o.g big spoon latches.
-Original semaphores.
-All interior & exterior handles are o.g for a bit of patina!
-One key fits all locks, with a spare included.

Interior.....

-Original front bench seat in original material, expertly repaired by J&S upholstery.
-Westfalia rock & roll bed.
-Full set of 'subtle' J&S Upholstery curtains which cover every window.
-Chequered lino floor.
-Basic hardboard 'door cards'.
-Fully re-done West Coast Metric headliner.
-Fully recovered mohair sunroof with o.g Golde handle.
-Blaupunkt Hamburg Bluetooth/MP3/CD player. Blaupunkt component speakers in the front & Blaupunkt 6x9's in the rear.

Exterior.....

-All photographs documenting work & showing lead loading of the replacement panels.
-N.O.S cab doors.
-O.g front panel unpicked, repaired, lead loaded then replaced.
-Full repaint of top half in gloss Chestnut Brown and the bottom half in Satin Sealing Wax Red for a bit of a patina look, this could easily be repainted in gloss.
-All o.g glass apart from 2 pop-outs, I had to source these as the bus would originally only have 2 pop-outs.
-All new seals.
-Genuine ribbed bumpers painted in gloss sealing wax red (the rears need the correct slash-cut trim). I have the painted splash pans for the rear.
-O.g wiper arms & spindles.

Electrical.....

-Full new wiring loom.
-Recent starter motor.
-Good 'correct' Euro spec rear lights.
-Late U.S spec front lights with H4 halogen inserts - these really are uber bright as commented by the guy in front of at Vanfest!
-O.g centre brake light housing & bezel.
-Bumper mounted o.g Bosch horn.
-Alternator conversion.

O.K. so here's the deal. Although this isn't the world's most original early Samba (good luck finding one for less than 60 grand!), I feel there is enough scope to return this bus close to original spec. I built the bus for me and only me, I never planned on selling this bus but times & needs change so here it is. The upgrades/changes I have made were based on improving the look and drive of the bus. I know this bus is priced on the nose but there are bits I would ideally like to keep and am willing to negotiate on, namely the wheels, brakes, engine & gauges. The bus can be supplied on Crows Feet wheels if required & I also have a set of Randars kicking about. I am going to do an early bay I have as a stop gap and these bits will work with what I have in mind for that, so no problem either way!

There are probably some other bits I've forgotten but feel free to call me on 07773 010 061 after 4pm if you're interested.

Cheers.

Gill.
